summary: This document is an email chain from December 2018 between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel, discussing a request for notes and records from a 2016 meeting with attorney Peter Skinner. The chain includes forwarded emails from Skinner in 2016, which reference media reporting on Jeffrey Epstein and share legal documents related to a defamation case against Ghislaine Maxwell and a Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) case.

persons.name: Peter Skinner
persons.context: An attorney who met with the U.S. Attorney's Office in 2016, forwarded a 2016 news article about Jeffrey Epstein, and shared legal documents related to cases involving Ghislaine Maxwell and a CVRA case.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Identified by Peter Skinner as one of the lead attorneys on a case, who knows the facts well and was added to an email chain for follow-up.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a forwarded 2016 news article about his continued relationships with young women, which was shared by Peter Skinner.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of a defamation case; a motion to dismiss in that case was denied by Judge Sweet on the day of the 2016 email.

persons.name: Judge Sweet
persons.context: The judge who denied Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in a defamation case on February 29, 2016.

events.title: Page Six Report on Epstein
events.description: The New York Post's Page Six reported on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women.

events.title: Meeting with Peter Skinner
events.description: Peter Skinner met with representatives from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Maxwell's Motion to Dismiss Denied
events.description: Judge Sweet denied Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in a defamation case.

events.title: Request for 2016 Meeting Notes
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office followed up internally to obtain notes and records from the 2016 meeting with Peter Skinner.

keyFacts: In December 2018, the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was seeking notes and documents from a 2016 meeting with attorney Peter Skinner regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
Peter Skinner had forwarded a March 2016 Page Six article reporting on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

On February 29, 2016, Skinner shared legal documents with the U.S. Attorney's Office, including a complaint in a defamation case against Ghislaine Maxwell (where her motion to dismiss was denied that day), declarations and a Rule 56.1 statement from a CVRA case, and a redacted FBI 302 form.
Sigrid McCawley was identified as a lead attorney on a case related to these matters and was included in email coordination.

The email chain demonstrates ongoing interest and information sharing between private attorneys and federal prosecutors regarding Epstein-related legal cases in 2016, with follow-up by prosecutors in late 2018.
